2000.info: The start game event is triggered at the very beginning of the game (after the game finishes loading, don’t wait for intro movie to finish). This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: identifier of the current version of the game being played
args.name: version

2010.info: The exit game event is triggered when the game is quit. This is used to compute things like time spent in game. Depending on platform this may / may not be possible. NOTE: “quit” also means navigating away from game.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: session_duration

args.info: “closed container”, “game ended”, or browser exit/navigation
args.name: exit_type

2020.info: The start wash/dry/rinse/brush event is triggered after the player selects a character is prompted to wash, dry, rinse, and brush the characters hair.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

2021.info: The start cutting event is triggered after the player clicks on the button to start cutting hair and is presented with the haircut screen.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

2022.info: The start decorating event is triggered after the player clicks on the button to start decorating the character and is presented with the decoration screen.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

2030.info: The finish wash/dry/rinse/brush event is triggered after the player clicks the button to begin cutting the character’s hair.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the duration of the section in milliseconds.
args.name: duration

2031.info: The finish cutting event is triggered after the player clicks the button to begin decorating and is presented with the decoration screen.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the duration of the section in milliseconds.
args.name: duration

2032.info: The finish cutting event is triggered when the player finishes decorating the character and presses the picture button.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the duration of the section in milliseconds.
args.name: duration

3010.info: The system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game delivers instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. This event differs from events 3020 and 3021 as it captures instructions that are not given in response to player action. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions. We can answer questions like, "did players who received instruction X do better than those who did not?"

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info:
the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

3110.info: The end of system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game finishes delivering instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction including duration. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions and the amount of time they consume. We can answer questions like, "how much time elapsed while the game was presenting instruction?"

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info:
the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4010.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to start the game from the starting screen.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

4015.info: This event occurs when the player clicks one of the characters. It contains information about the character that was selected.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: name of the character selected
args.name: character

4020.info: This event occurs after the player drags one of the interactive tools over the character and then replaces the tool or picks up a new tool. It contains information about the tool that was dragged and the duration of the action.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: the duration of the action in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: did the player complete the action (all brushes, drying for the full countdown, etc.)?
args.name: completed_action

args.info: name of the tool that was used e.g. – “dryer”, “soap”, “water”, “brush”, etc.
args.name: tool

4025.info: This event occurs when the player drags the scissors or hair growing elixir over the character’s hair. It contains information about the tool that was dragged and the length of the hair.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: new length of the hair after the event occurs – e.g. “short”, “shorter”, “shortest”, etc.
args.name: length

args.info: “grow” or “cut” – the action performed
args.name: action

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4027.info: This event occurs when the player places a decoration on the character. It contains information about the decoration that was placed and the location of the placement.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

args.info: name of the decoration that was placed
args.name: decoration

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4030.info: This event occurs when the player picks up an object by clicking on it, or begins dragging an object. It contains information about the object that was picked up and the position of the click.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

args.info: name of the object picked up e.g. “pointy glasses”, “hair dryer”, “scissors”, etc.
args.name: object

4035.info: This event occurs when the player drags an object to someplace other than an acceptable destination for the object. It contains information about the object being moved and the destination. The event should occur when the drag is released and the object is placed. These events are used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

args.info: name of the object picked up e.g. “pointy glasses”, “hair dryer”, “scissors”, etc.
args.name: object

args.info: “resources” or “stage” location the object was dragged from
args.name: source

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4050.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the button to change to the next section.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

args.info: “cutting” or “decorating” – name of the section selected
args.name: section

4070.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on something that isn’t covered elsewhere. It can be useful in determining if there are attractive distractions (things the player think should do something, but don’t) in the game, or diagnosing players who are having mechanical difficulties (near misses).

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time
coordinates

4080.info: This event occurs when the player hovers the mouse over an interactive object. It contains information about the object under the mouse, and the duration of the hover. This event can be used to diagnose things like planning (are they hovering the mouse over tiles for long periods before they use those tiles), and determine which objects the player thinks are important.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: how long the mouse cursor dwells over the object when the player dwells for longer than 1sec
args.name: dwell_time

args.info: the object or piece of art the player clicked on
args.name: object

4090.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on the help button. It contains information about the state of the game that caused the player to seek help. This event is usually followed by a 3010 (system-initiated instruction) event. It helps identify points that players feel are too difficult.

args.info: millisecond count since start of game
args.name: game_time

args.info: “washing”, “cutting” or “decorating” – current mode of play
args.name: section
